intro: Maytenus heyneana, commonly known as the Brazilian mulberry, is a small to medium-sized evergreen tree native to South America. It belongs to the family Celastraceae and is characterized by its dense, glossy green leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces small, round berries that are typically green when immature and turn red when mature. It is often found in tropical and subtropical regions, growing in a variety of habitats including forests and along riverbanks. The tree is valued for its ornamental appeal and has some traditional uses in local medicine.
